Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2009 07:34PM klml4 wrote: Thank you for posting this!!  I had asked a very similar question inside one of my posts, but didnt get a response.  I was so happy to see that Im not alone in feeling the way I do.  I am going in for bilateral mastectomies on December 4th.  I dont want to "do" anything because I figure I will cry through it, and after surgery is done--well, I cant even imagine how I will feel then!!  I wish I could just get it out of my head--just forget the fact that I wil only have breasts for 2 1/2 more weeks, and just enjoy my DH, but I cant!!!  I am going to TRY sometime before the surgery.  I would love to go away with him for  a couple nights without the kids and try it that way.  I am planning on having see my "skin bumps" after the surgery and TE are in--maybe it would be better for both of us if he sees them right away and I know he is used to them??  I dont know--who knows how I will l feel when its done.  Anyway, thank you for posting your question.  good luck with everythng!!
Posts.Title: I need help in the bedroom - any advice? Asterix1234 TaminMo

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2009 06:53PM klml4 wrote: I sent you a pm Im going for bilateral mastectomy in 3 weeks.  I would love one of these pillows. thanks
Posts.Title: Heart-Shaped Pillows choca1711 SLL101984

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2009 06:33PM klml4 wrote: I went for my post op yesterday too.  I got 2 of 4 drains out--I was very happy about that!!  I also got the final pathology and the cancer is GONE!!  no invasive anything, lymphs clear!  No radiation, chemo, or tamoxifen for me!!  I can move my arms around alot more than I thought I would be able to.  But I am stil taking it slow.  Yesterday I went out for the first time since leaving the hospital.  DH and I went to my work and dropped off some thank you cards, then went out to lunch, walked around the mall a tiny bit then went to the Dr.  While in the middle of my appt, I thought I was going to pass out!!  I had to lay down and after about 5 minutes the dizziness and nausia went away--my DH ended up getting a wheelchair to wheel me out of the hospital!! LOL!!  So, I guess I learned my lesson--I have to go much slower with my activity!  So happy the cancer is GONE!!!  I knew it would be after having bmx, but it was so nice to hear!!  I finally had a breakdown--hadnt had one yet!!  I sobbed for about 15 minutes (with relief).  Boy did that hurt to cry that hard!!  My chest really hurt!! Ive been going back and forth with my foobs.  One day I hate them, the next I think they arent that bad--today I think they are gross and look so mutilated!!  But, I have expanders, and they will be changing size and shape so much over the coming months, I need to stop examining them.   I LOVE my Softee Two!  I bought 2 of them before surgery and have been wearing one everyday since the surgery.  My Dr doesnt use the after surgery bra's that I hear are very tight and can be uncomfortable.  I like having the Softee on though--so soft and comfortable!  I figure I will get a lot of use since I wont be buying a bra for so long.  I will at least have this to wear under my shirts.  I guess thats all for now.  Im glad to see that others are doing well after their surgery too. --Kendra--
Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Content: klml4 wrote: I have DCIS and after 2 surgeries failed to remove the cancer I have decided to have mastectomy.  I am 37, and decided to have both breasts done because of a strong family history.  My mother was 35 when she was first diagnosed, and died at age 41.  Her mother died when she was 47--Im not sure what age she was diagnosed.  I was planning on just the lumpectomy, rads and tamoxifen, but it didnt work out for me.  After the 2nd surgery there was still alot of cancer cells (grade 2 and 3) in one area.  I had to think long and hard about it, but decided that this would be the best option for me.  At first I was happy and upbeat.  I knew I made the right decision to do mx, but after a few days the realization of not having breasts anymore hit me.  I was crying at everything.  I would be fine one second and a crying mess the next.  I went to my primary care and got some anti-anxiety meds.  that has helped me so much.  but I am down to just 3 weeks left with my breasts.  I should be happy to get rid of them and be done with the cancer--but Im not.  Im sad, and upset.  I know I am lucky, I only have to have the surgery and nothing else.  But I still feel so sad.  I havent read anything about this subject at all in my time looking around here, and I hope I dont offend anyone, but I am wondering how women going through this face having sex??  My husband and I have not done anything since I decided on the mastectomy.  I know that I will cry during lovemaking, because I know I will be losing my breasts soon.  I cant even imagine making love after the mx.  I will be getting TE's and saline later.  I feel like I will have freak skin bumps--I cant even consider them boobs.  Nippleless, numb, skin bumps--yuck!!!  I think I will have to find some lingerie or something to hide behind if we are ever going to make love again.  Does anyone else feel this way??  I also feel guilty that I dont want to do anything.  I LOVE my husband so much!!  He is the biggest support to me.  I know he doesnt care about me having boobs at all.  He has told me he only sees them as a problem now, and something that could possibly end our life together (if the cancer came back and was really bad and invasive next time).   He is very happy that I decidedd to go this route instead of trying another re-excision.  Am I alone in feeling this way?? Thank you everyone for being here.  This website has been the BEST source of info and encouragement for me. --Kendra-- 37 yrs old DCIS grade 3 ER+/PR- diagnosed 8/17/09 bmx 12/4 after 2 lumpectomies w/o clear margins Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2009 12:26PM klml4 wrote: I will taking before and after nude pics also.  as the process of the fills goes on....till my completed foobs!!!  My bag is half ready--and my best friend secretly took a pic of my daughters holding a sign that says "i love you" and framed it for me to bring the hospital since they wont be allwoed to visit.    Rebecca, get some rest--I am wishing you the best for Tuesday!!
Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2009 11:37PM klml4 wrote: Thank you everyone.  I am set to be at the hospital at 5:45 tomorrow morning and the surgery is supposed to start at 7:30.  Im doing ok but Im nervous.  Im not even attemting to go to sleep right now since I dont think it will work.  I will be so releived when its over.  I will come back and try to update soon!  Thank you for your thoughts and posts and sharing your experiences with me--it is greatly appreciated. --Kendra--
Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2009 10:54PM klml4 wrote: Hi guys! I havd my bmx yesterday (friday 4th).    want to let yo know tat Im doing ok.  I as in pain last night, and I threw up all over myself.  It was about 1a.m. and so dark, and I could barely move because it huts so much.  I no understand the feel of the iron bra or the tightness of the chest muscles.  i guess you just cant explain it, you have exerience.  I dont like it at all. I will be here in the hopsital till Monday or tuesday.  they said its my choice, and I would rather be here at home.  I am really out of it ight now-I have a morphene button.  Tomorrow they willtake it out and I will be on pills.  I am SO SO itchy (i think from the morphene)  But its keeping th pain downtoned for now, so  I would ather be itchy.  I just took a benedryl,. ok, I think im gong to try to nap,  I am completely exhausted.
Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2009 07:14PM klml4 wrote: Hi, I read my post from the hospital, LOL!!  I could clearly see that I was on morphiene!!  I am still on pain meds, now, so I may still mess up my typing!! i have 4 drains in--they are such a pain!!  I cant wait to get rid of them!  I am still regularly taking pain meds (persocet).  I stayed in the hospital till Tuesday--they kept asking if I was ready to leave and I kept telling them no!  I stayed as long as I could.  I am sleeping in a recliner now.  Something that I want to add to to the packing list for surgery is a back scratcher!!  I think I was allergic to morphene, and was so so itchy!!  My dad bought me a back scratcher while I was there, and I am still using it often as my range of motion with my arms is limited.  Although, i can move them a lot more than I thought I would be able to.  My Dr says no to showers so my DH has been helping me sponge bath and washing my hair for me.  He has been so so wonderful!!  My foobs dont look too bad.  I am still way smaller than I am used to (I was a D) so these little perky foobs are different!  I was very upset with them at first, but now I realize they really arent too bad.  Everyone--all the nurses at the hospital and the visiting nurse is very impressed with how the incisions look!!  they really are very very clean!! I guess thats it for now.  I will continue checking in.  I hope that everyone else who has been in for sugery recently is doing well!! --Kendra--
Posts.Title: having bilateral mx December 4th klml4 Issymom

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2010 10:40PM klml4 wrote: Hi I see that nobody answered you yet.  I dont really have any answers for you though.  When I asked My Dr about going to the gym just to use the treadmill and/or eliptical he said to listen to my body.  If I started to hurt then stop doing it.  Lifting weights with your arms, I dont know.....Ive had a weight limit of nothing over 15 pounds for quite a while--but I also just had a compilcation and a second surgery.  I hope someone else has an answer, but it might be a good idea to call your Drs office just to double check and get a real straight answer with any/all restrictions. --Kendra--
Posts.Title: 5 weeks post BMX-- What is over doing it? precioustime precioustime

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2009 08:16PM klml4 wrote: He suspects maybe it was the bulbs of the drains??  He switched them out and gave me new ones.   There is no sign of infectioins what-so-ever, so he was a little pu8zzled by the odor.  Thanks for your input
Posts.Title: Help, I have a drain question --(odor?) klml4 klml4

Posts.Content: klml4 wrote: I had bilat mx on Dec 4th with TE's now that I had my drains removed I am developing seromas.  Dr said that it isnt bad and doesnt want to drain it because of the risk of hitting the TE.  He wants me to start wearing a sports bra now --(i think for some compression) Ive had "binders" on, but thats not working out very well--it slides down if we dont wrap it tight enough and if its too tight, it puts too much pressure on the seroma and it hurts.  So, my DH drove me to a couple stores last night, but neither of the places we went sold sports bras that zip in the front--they are all pull overs, and I cant do a pull over.  Do any of you have any recommendations for me??  Thanks --Kendra-- 37 yrs old DCIS grade 3 ER+/PR- diagnosed 8/17/09 bmx 12/4 after 2 lumpectomies w/o clear margins Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: looking for sports bra recommendations?? klml4 faithfulc

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2010 09:49AM klml4 wrote: Thanks for the suggestions everyone!!
Posts.Title: looking for sports bra recommendations?? klml4 faithfulc

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2009 07:02PM klml4 wrote: My ps doesnt like to use bra's after surgery either.  I bought myself 2 Softee Two post mastectomy camisoles  though, and I have been wearing them day and night since my surgery on Dec 4th!  They are so comfortable and not constricting at all.  I absolutely LOVE them!!
Posts.Title: Bra less post surgery??? lauramc bcincolorado

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2009 03:55PM klml4 wrote: Thanks.  I did decide to call the ps this morning.  Im leaving in a few minutes to be seen.  I was hoping they would say dont worry about it, but they said I need to come in. Thanks for your input! I didnt even know that you could lose TEs because of infection.
Posts.Title: Help, I have a drain question --(odor?) klml4 klml4

Posts.Content: klml4 wrote: I have had these drains since the 4th, this morning when I emptied and measured, I noticed an odor from ONE of the drains.  I emptied and measured one of them, then did the next one.  When I poured  out the second one, I noticed a smell.  I picked up the cup that I just emptied into to see if it was that or something else, and it was that.  That made me sniff the other one, which has no odor at all.   I kind of forgot about it,  then tonight the same thing happened.  I smelled the bulb too, and that has the odor.  My temp is normal, I have no unusual pain, it still feels the same--the skin around the drain tube looks fine.  Its just an odor.  I dont know what to think of it??  I have an appt with my plastic surgeon Wednesday.  Do you think it can wait, or should I call the office before then??  37 yrs old DCIS grade 3 ER+/PR- diagnosed 8/17/09 bmx 12/4 after 2 lumpectomies w/o clear margins Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help, I have a drain question --(odor?) klml4 klml4

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2009 09:59PM klml4 wrote: Hi Nikki, I am pretty new to posting here as well.  I am 37 also, and will be having bilteral mx on December 4th. Im having immediate reconstruction with tissue expanders.  I was diagnosed with DCIS on 8/17 and have had a lumpectomy and re-excision which failed to clear all the cancer--still lots of cancer left in one area, so we are doing the bmx.  I hope that your surgery goes well!!!!  I will be thinking of you!! --Kendra--
